document_title: Liver cancer: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Most people have no signs and symptoms in the early stages of primary liver cancer. Obvious signs often come at a late stage such as:
Unexplained weight loss;; Loss of appetite;; Feeling of heaviness, pain or self-palpable mass in the right lower quadrant;; Nausea and vomiting;; Fatigue, physical weakness;; Distention;; Yellow skin, yellow eyes, dark urine, pale stools;; Fever.
The most common symptom of liver cancer is pain in the upper abdomen
